page.title: 01THE MARSHWOOD VALE
page.content: Broadoak and district is a rural area with farming being the main employment. It is good grass-growing land with many small copses and ponds. The southern side of the block is a steep hill flattening out towards the north into small fields enclosed by hedges including many oak trees, a feature of the Marshwood Vale. The farms are small, approximately 150 acres, and dairying is the main enterprise with some sheep and pigs. The largest employer is a farm making Traditional Farmhouse Cheddar with bacon pigs fed on whey, the cheese by-product, a traditional West Dorset cycle. Creeds the Printers are the main non-agricultural employers. Many families in the block go back several generations, and as yet we have only two or three holiday cottages. The Broadoak Village Hall is a focal point
